Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[tests] fix Windows test failures" (#1583) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/index?buildId=1605061&tab=ms.vss-test-web.test-result-details&_a=summary

Noticed these are probably failing since 41bc8ff, but the build was
not working overall on Windows at the time--so we didn't catch it.

The `CheckSignApk` test had a couple issues:
- `C:\Users\myuser\Documents\android-toolchain\sdk` was being used as
the location of the Android SDK on Windows. `BaseTest` needed to use
`Environment.SpecialFolder.UserProfile` instead of `Personal`.
- `apksigner` is `apksigner.bat` instead of `apksigner.exe` on Windows

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Generate source file with XA build paths" (#1568) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
The generated file contains paths to the top source directory, `xabuild`,
`xabuild.exe`, current `bin` directory, current test output directory and a
constant with the current configuration name. The paths can be useful in test
projects to find various bits and pieces which are currently referred to using
paths relative to a specific location and thus not really "portable" between
various test projects.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Use implicit doc redirection" (#1584) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
The Windows `.vsix` file is *huge*, for two reasons (among others):

1. We have to ship `Mono.Android.dll` for *14* (soon to be *15*) `$(TargetFrameworkVersion)` values, and *each one* is around 20MB in size.
2. *Documentation XML Files*.

Documentation is *larger than* the assemblies:

```
$ unzip -l ~/Downloads/Xamarin.Android.Sdk.8.3.0.18.vsix | grep xml$
 57309057  04-17-2018 15:07   $ReferenceAssemblies/Microsoft/Framework/MonoAndroid/v4.2/Mono.Android.xml
      131  04-17-2018 15:07   $ReferenceAssemblies/Microsoft/Framework/MonoAndroid/v7.0/AndroidApiInfo.xml
 57309057  04-17-2018 15:07   $ReferenceAssemblies/Microsoft/Framework/MonoAndroid/v4.3/Mono.Android.xml
...
```

~57 *MB* for `Mono.Android.xml`, for *each* `$(TargetFrameworkVersion)`. (Then there's `mscorlib.xml`, which is full of `To be added` docs, and thus useless...)

However, documentation supports "redirection":

```xml
<doc redirect="%PROGRAMFILESDIR%Reference Assemblies\Microsoft\Framework\.NETFramework\v4.X\mscorlib.xml" />
```

We should check to see if `/doc/@redirect` can contain *relative* paths, and if it *can*, we can replace all but the "latest" `Mono.Android.xml` with a "redirect" to the latest, a'la:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<doc redirect="..\v8.1\Mono.Android.xml" />
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[tests] fix Windows test failures" (#1583) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Noticed these are probably failing since 41bc8ff, but the build was
not working overall on Windows at the time--so we didn't catch it.

The `CheckSignApk` test had a couple issues:
- `C:\Users\myuser\Documents\android-toolchain\sdk` was being used as
the location of the Android SDK on Windows. `BaseTest` needed to use
`Environment.SpecialFolder.UserProfile` instead of `Personal`.
- `apksigner` is `apksigner.bat` instead of `apksigner.exe` on Windows

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Implicit BroadcastReceiver does not work" (#1582) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a BroadcastReceiver that listens to the boot completed intent
2. Open the app at least once
3. Restart your device

I have a repro project, but I can't share it publicly.
Broadcast receiver:

```
[assembly: UsesPermission(Name = Manifest.Permission.ReceiveBootCompleted)]

namespace Something
{
	[BroadcastReceiver(Enabled = true, DirectBootAware = true)]
	[IntentFilter(new[] {Intent.ActionLockedBootCompleted, Intent.ActionBootCompleted}, Categories = new []{Intent.CategoryDefault})]
	public class BootedBroadcastReceiver : MvxBroadcastReceiver
	{
		public override void OnReceive(Context context, Intent intent)
		{
// it does not even reach this point
			base.OnReceive(context, intent);
			Log.Info("Boot message received");
			ForegroundSyncService.Start(context);
		}
	}
}
```

### Expected Behavior
The code in the broadcast receiver runs.

### Actual Behavior
The process/app crashes with the error `No implementation found for void mono.android.Runtime.register(java.lang.String, java.lang.Class, java.lang.String) (tried Java_mono_android_Runtime_register and Java_mono_android_Runtime_register__Ljava_lang_String_2Ljava_lang_Class_2Ljava_lang_String_2)`

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Debugger is not starting with VS15.6.6 and Galaxy S8 with Android 8" (#1553) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Debug an app with VS15.6.6 and Galaxy S8 with the new Android 8
2. The app id deployed to the device and the debugger starts
3. The app is not starting on the device and the debugger hangs (For Android-Application debugging is executed (translated))
4. It is possible to start the app manually on the device, but not via the debugger
5. With other smartphones (with older Android versions) or simulators the debugging is working correctly

### Expected Behavior
The debugger should start the app

### Actual Behavior

The debugger is not starting the app and hangs

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[iOS] Picker IsFocused not being set back to false if nothing in picker was selected" (#2433) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Fixed picker on iOS so when nothing gets selected and it's closed that IsFocused gets correctly set back to false

This is a 2.5.1 to 3.0.0 regression so let me know if you want me to retarget this to 3.0.0

### Bugs Fixed ###

fixes #2398

### PR Checklist ###

- [X] Has tests (if omitted, state reason in description)
- [X] Rebased on top of master at time of PR
- [X] Changes adhere to coding standard
- [X] Consolidate commits as makes sense

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Pin.Clicked does not work" (#2509) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
Event listener is not triggered for Pin.Clicked event,
Looks like this bug is opened again,
https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=25557

### Steps to Reproduce

1. var pin = new Pin()...
2. pin.Clicked += PinOnClicked;
3. Map.Pins.Add(pin)

### Expected Behavior
PinOnClicked should be triggered,

### Actual Behavior
PinOnClicked is not called. Event is not triggered on clicking pin in the map,

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 2.5.0.280555
- Last known good version: Don't know
- IDE: Visual Studio 2017 (15.6.6)
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - Android: 8.0
- Android Support Library Version: <!-- if applicable -->
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices:

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "TriggerAction Properties Can't be Compiled on Build When Set in xaml" (#2508) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

When a TriggerAction Property is set in Xaml, the code cannot be compiled when XamlCompilation is enabled. (Works fine when disabled).

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Compile Attached Code
2. Uncomment the Trigger Action with a Property
3. Try to Build

### Expected Behavior

Code Compiles

### Actual Behavior

Build Fails with "error : opcode"

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: Tested on 2.5.0 & 2.5.1
- Last known good version: unknown
- IDE: VS 2017 15.6.6
- Platforms Effected: All

### Reproduction Link

https://github.com/sonic1015/bugRepo/releases/tag/2

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Android] Disable long press detection so it doesn't prevent pans in TapAndPanGestureDetector" (#2414) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Disables long press detection in TapAndPanGestureDetector; the long press firing prevents the scroll from initiating.

### Bugs Fixed ###

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[generator] Improve error message." (#3960) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Merged pull request "[apidiff] Update mono-api-html and Makefile to output markdown for API diffs" (#3956) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Opened pull request "[src] Fix rebuilding pdb files." (#3961) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
There was a problem with the logic to install pdb files, where they'd only be
touched if they already existed instead of updated.

This causes frequent problems when building locally, because symbols would be
out of date (resulting in build warnings, broken debugging, etc).

Since it only happens when assemblies are rebuilt, this was not a problem for
packages built on wrench.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[generator] Improve error message." (#3960) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Merged pull request "[build] Sprinkle -nologo to csc usages to avoid spam fest in our logs" (#3958) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
This commit https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/pull/3815/commits/7623ca9ec8cfd466460d1feb0f89a64795b32167 removed /nologo from the general SYSTEM_CSC declaration because it was not usable that way in every case where csc was used. This commit removes the spam fest output from src build.

I am not sure if we want to get rid of it this way or if we want a more general fix instead of sprinkling `-nologo` everywhere.
